verses.verse: (1 John 4:5) If you were of the world, the world would love its own. Yet (John 17:14) because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

Remember the word that I said to you, (Matt. 10:24; John 13:16) ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. (Ezek. 3:7) If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.
But (Matt. 10:22; 24:9; (1 Pet. 4:14); Rev. 2:3) all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.
(John 9:41; 15:24) If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, ((Rom. 1:20; James 4:17)) but now they have no excuse for their sin.
(1 John 2:23) He who hates Me hates My Father also.
If I had not done among them (John 3:2) the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have (John 14:9) seen and also hated both Me and My Father.
But this happened that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, (Ps. 35:19; 69:4; 109:3-5) ‘They hated Me without a cause.’

The Coming Rejection (Luke 24:49; (John 14:17); Acts 2:4, 33) “But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, (1 John 5:6) He will testify of Me.
And (Luke 24:48; 1 Pet. 5:1; 2 Pet. 1:16) you also will bear witness, because (Matt. 3:14; Luke 1:2; 1 John 1:1) you have been with Me from the beginning.
“These things I have spoken to you, that you (Matt. 11:6) should not be made to stumble.
(John 9:22) They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming (Acts 8:1) that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service.
And (John 8:19; 15:21; Acts 13:27; Rom. 10:2) these things they will do to you because they have not known the Father nor Me.
But these things I have told you, that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you of them. And these things I did not say to you at the beginning, because I was with you.
The Work of the Holy Spirit “But now I (John 7:33; 13:33; 14:28; 17:11) go away to Him who sent Me, and none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’
But because I have said these things to you, (Matt. 17:23; (John 16:20, 22)) sorrow has filled your heart.
Nevertheless I tell you the truth. It is to your advantage that I go away; for if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you; but (Acts 2:33) if I depart, I will send Him to you.
And when He has (Acts 1:8; 2:1-4, 37) come, He will convict the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:
(Acts 2:22) of sin, because they do not believe in Me;
(Acts 2:32) of righteousness, (John 5:32) because I go to My Father and you see Me no more;
(Acts 26:18) of judgment, because ((Luke 10:18)) the ruler of this world is judged.
“I still have many things to say to you, (Mark 4:33) but you cannot bear them now.

However, when He, ((John 14:17)) the Spirit of truth, has come, (John 14:26; Acts 11:28; Rev. 1:19) He will guide you into all truth; for He will not speak on His own authority, but whatever He hears He will speak; and He will tell you things to come.
(John 15:26) He will glorify Me, for He will take of what is Mine and declare it to you.
(Matt. 11:27; John 3:35) All things that the Father has are Mine. Therefore I said that He will take of Mine and declare it to you.

Sorrow Will Turn to Joy “A (John 7:33; 12:35; 13:33; 14:19; 19:40-42; 20:19) little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me, (John 13:3) because I go to the Father.”

Then some of His disciples said among themselves, “What is this that He says to us, ‘A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me’ ; and, ‘because I go to the Father’ ?”
They said therefore, “What is this that He says, ‘A little while’ ? We do not know what He is saying.”

Now Jesus knew that they desired to ask Him, and He said to them, “Are you inquiring among yourselves about what I said, ‘A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me’?

Most assuredly, I say to you that you will weep and (Mark 16:10; Luke 23:48; 24:17) lament, but the world will rejoice; and you will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into (Luke 24:32, 41) joy.

(Gen. 3:16; Is. 13:8; 26:17; 42:14; 1 Thess. 5:3) A woman, when she is in labor, has sorrow because her hour has come; but as soon as she has given birth to the child, she no longer remembers the anguish, for joy that a human being has been born into the world.
Therefore you now have sorrow; but I will see you again and (Luke 24:41; John 14:1, 27; 20:20; Acts 2:46; 13:52; 1 Pet. 1:8) your heart will rejoice, and your joy no one will take from you.
“And in that day you will ask Me nothing. (Matt. 7:7; (John 14:13; 15:16)) Most assuredly, I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in My name He will give you.
Until now you have asked nothing in My name. Ask, and you will receive, (John 17:13) that your joy may be (John 15:11) full.
